sourceText: It is fine to say “We don’t know, but we are working on it; or we don’t know, ‘but we think’.”
text: It is fine to say “We don’t know, but we are working on it; or we don’t know, ‘but we think’.”

sourceText: Use this as an opportunity to learn something new with your child!
text: Use this as an opportunity to learn something new with your child!

sourceText: Allow your child to talk freely. Ask them open questions and find out how much they already know.
text: Allow your child to talk freely. Ask them open questions and find out how much they already know.

sourceText: Always answer their questions truthfully. Think about how old your child is and how much they can understand.
text: Always answer their questions truthfully. Think about how old your child is and how much they can understand.

sourceText: Be open and listen.
text: Be open and listen.

sourceText: Be honest.
text: Be honest.

sourceText: Be supportive.
text: Be supportive.

sourceText: It is OK not to know the answers.
text: It is OK not to know the answers.

sourceText: There are a lot of stories going around
text: There are a lot of stories going around

sourceText: Some may not be true. Use trustworthy sites:https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019/advice-for-publicandhttps://www.unicef.org/coronavirus/covid-19from WHO and UNICEF.
text: Some may not be true. Use trustworthy sites:https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019/advice-for-publicandhttps://www.unicef.org/coronavirus/covid-19from WHO and UNICEF.

sourceText: Check to see if your child is okay. Remind them that you care and that they can talk to you anytime. Then do something fun together!
text: Check to see if your child is okay. Remind them that you care and that they can talk to you anytime. Then do something fun together!

sourceText: End on a good note.
text: End on a good note.

sourceText: Talking about COVID-19
text: Talking about COVID-19

sourceText: Covid-19 Parenting
text: Covid-19 Parenting

sourceText: Be willing to talk. They will already have heard something. Silence and secrets do not protect our children.
text: Be willing to talk. They will already have heard something. Silence and secrets do not protect our children.

sourceText: Honesty and openness do. Think about how much they will understand.
text: Honesty and openness do. Think about how much they will understand.

sourceText: You know them best.
text: You know them best.

sourceText: Your child may be scared or confused.
text: Your child may be scared or confused.

sourceText: Give them space to share how they are feeling and let them know you are there for them.
text: Give them space to share how they are feeling and let them know you are there for them.

sourceText: Heroes not bullies.
text: Heroes not bullies.

sourceText: Explain that COVID-19 has nothing to do with the way someone looks, where they are from, or what language they speak.
text: Explain that COVID-19 has nothing to do with the way someone looks, where they are from, or what language they speak.

sourceText: Tell your child that we can be compassionate to people who are sick and those who are caring for them.
text: Tell your child that we can be compassionate to people who are sick and those who are caring for them.

sourceText: Look for stories of people who are working to stop the outbreak and are caring for sick people.
text: Look for stories of people who are working to stop the outbreak and are caring for sick people.
